1902060.book: Hadith Describing The Manner Rasoolullah Drank
1902060.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902060
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 001
1902060.text: Ibn 'Abbas said (may Allah be well pleased with him and his father): “The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) drank from [the water of] Zamzam while standing.”

1902070.book: Hadith Describing The Manner Rasoolullah Drank
1902070.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902070
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 002
1902070.text: 'Amr ibn Shu'aib reports on the authority of his father that his grandfather said: "I saw Allah's Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) drink while both standing and sitting.”

1902080.book: Hadith Describing The Manner Rasoolullah Drank
1902080.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902080
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 003
1902080.text: Ibn 'Abbas said (may Allah be well pleased with him and his father): "I gave Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) Zamzam water, and he drank it standing up.”

1902090.book: Hadith Describing The Manner Rasoolullah Drank
1902090.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902090
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 004
1902090.text: An-Nazzal ibn Sabra said; "Ali (may Allah be well pleased with him) brought a jug of water, while he was in ar-Rahba, after which he dipped out a handful, washed his hands, rinsed his mouth, snuffed up his nostrils, and wiped his face, his forearms and his head. Then he drank from it while standing. Then he said: 'This is the minor ritual ablution of someone who has not excreted any substance that would render him ritually impure. I saw Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) act in this manner'."

1902100.book: Hadith Describing The Manner Rasoolullah Drank
1902100.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902100
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 005
1902100.text: Anas ibn Malik said (may Allah be well pleased with him): "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to breathe into the vessel three times when he drank, and he would say: 'It is more wholesome and more thirst-quenching!’”

1902110.book: Hadith Describing The Manner Rasoolullah Drank
1902110.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902110
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 006
1902110.text: Ibn 'Abbas said (may Allah be well pleased with him and his father): "When the Prophet drank (Allah bless him and give him peace), he used to take two breaths.”

1902120.book: Hadith Describing The Manner Rasoolullah Drank
1902120.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902120
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 007
1902120.text: 'Abd ar-Rahman ibn Abi 'Amra said that his grandmother Kabsha said: "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) entered my presence, then he drank from a suspended waterskin while standing, so I reached up to its mouth and cut it loose.”

1902130.book: Hadith Describing The Manner Rasoolullah Drank
1902130.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902130
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 008
1902130.text: Thumama ibn 'Abdi’llah said: “Anas ibn Malik used to breathe into the vessel three times, and Anas ibn Malik maintained that the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) likewise used to breathe into the vessel three times.”

1902140.book: Hadith Describing The Manner Rasoolullah Drank
1902140.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902140
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 009
1902140.text: Anas ibn Malik said: "The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) entered the presence of Umm Sulaim, and a waterskin was suspended there, so he drank from the mouth of the waterskin while standing. Umm Sulaim therefore reached up to the head of the waterskin and cut it loose.”

1902150.book: Hadith Describing The Manner Rasoolullah Drank
1902150.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1902150
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 010
1902150.text: 'A’isha bint Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas reported that her father said: “The Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to drink while standing.”
